s.text: Empowerment refers to meeting the needs of girls and women so that they can freely exercise the power to determine and direct their lives.

In 1997 The United Way of Central Indiana generously assisted us with 25% of our budgetary needs; government and other foundation grants made up an additional 23%; and program fees and contribution from people like you provided the other 52%.

In 1997 The United Way of Central Indiana generously assisted us with 25% of our budgetary needs; government and other foundation grants made up an additional 23%; and program fees and contribution from people like you provided the other 52%.
Our Development program offers many giving opportunities to meet your company's or family's philanthropic needs to create positive change in your community.
Empowerment refers to meeting the needs of girls and women so that they can freely exercise the power to determine and direct their lives.
In 1985 a group of courageous pioneering women established the YWCA of Indianapolis to meet the needs of women, and in 1998 the tradition continues.
Empowerment refers to meeting the needs of girls and women so that they can freely exercise the power to determine and direct their lives.
Empowerment refers to meeting the needs of girls and women so that they can freely exercise the power to determine and direct their lives.

The YWCA is the oldest and largest organization for women and girls in the world and is dedicated to the empowerment of women, and the elimination of racism in order to attain a common vision of peace, justice, freedom, and dignity for all people.
